If you haven’t already, check out our [contributing guidelines](https://github.com/Expensify/ReactNativeChat/blob/main/contributingGuides/CONTRIBUTING.md) for onboarding and email contributors@expensify.com to request to join our Slack channel! ___ **Version Number:** 9.3.26-8 **Reproducible in staging?:** Y **Reproducible in production?:** Y **If this was caught during regression testing, add the test name, ID and link from BrowserStack:** **Email or phone of affected tester (no customers):** **Logs:** https://stackoverflow.com/c/expensify/questions/4856 **Expensify/Expensify Issue URL:** **Issue reported by:** @amyevans **Slack conversation** (hyperlinked to channel name): [#Expensify Bugs](https://expensify.slack.com/archives/C049HHMV9SM/p1772140855977489) ## Action Performed: 1. Set up a domain on Classic 2. Add a [Discover.com](http://discover.com/) company card feed 3. Assign a card 4. Set the preferredPolicy 5. Go to NewDot and open Workspaces > Company cards 6. Note that no feed displays 7. Go to Reports > Unapproved card 8. Go back to Workspaces > Company cards 9. Note that the Discover feed displays ## Expected Result: In Step 6, expected the feed to display ## Actual Result: Did not display until additional data was loaded via another API call ## Workaround: Unknown ## Platforms: Select the officially supported platforms where the issue was reproduced: - [ ] Android: App - [ ] Android: mWeb Chrome - [ ] iOS: App - [ ] iOS: mWeb Safari - [ ] iOS: mWeb Chrome - [x] Windows: Chrome - [x] MacOS: Chrome / Safari ## Screenshots/Videos https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/33bdd2c6-5ac6-4514-be8f-d3b1e70047db https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/7143c806-677c-4e68-a5b5-d5820347b44f [View all open jobs on GitHub](https://github.com/Expensify/App/issues?q=is%3Aopen+is%3Aissue+label%3A%22Help+Wanted%22)

title: [$250] PR Reviewer Checklist fails if more than 1 comment contains `# Reviewer Checklist` text

labels.name: External
labels.description: Added to denote the issue can be worked on by a contributor

labels.name: Daily
labels.description: KSv2

labels.name: Help Wanted
labels.description: Apply this label when an issue is open to proposals by contributors

labels.name: Bug
labels.description: Something is broken. Auto assigns a BugZero manager.

body:
In https://github.com/Expensify/App/pull/82448#issuecomment-3930910459, MelvinBot posted the comment: ``` The failing check is `checklist`, which was triggered by a `pull_request_review` event. This check looks for a comment containing `# Reviewer Checklist` with all items checked off — it's a process gate, not a code issue. **To fix this:** A reviewer needs to post the [Reviewer Checklist](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/Expensify/App/main/contributingGuides/REVIEWER_CHECKLIST.md) as a comment on this PR with all items checked. Once posted, the check will pass on the next run. No code changes are needed. ``` Later I posted the completed Reviewer Checklist in https://github.com/Expensify/App/pull/82448#issuecomment-3969372383. However, the `PR Reviewer Checklist` check continued to fail. The workflow does a simple `indexOf('# Reviewer Checklist')` search through comments in chronological order and stops at the first match, so it was never finding my checklist.
Issue OwnerCurrent Issue Owner: @truph01
Upwork Automation - Do Not Edit
  • Upwork Job URL: https://www.upwork.com/jobs/~022027170879042388990
  • Upwork Job ID: 2027170879042388990
  • Last Price Increase: 2026-02-26

If you haven’t already, check out our [contributing guidelines](https://github.com/Expensify/ReactNativeChat/blob/main/contributingGuides/CONTRIBUTING.md) for onboarding and email contributors@expensify.com to request to join our Slack channel! ___ **Version Number:** V9.3.26-4 **Reproducible in staging?:** Yes **Reproducible in production?:** N/A - new feature, doesn't exist in prod **If this was caught during regression testing, add the test name, ID and link from BrowserStack:** https://github.com/Expensify/App/pull/82257 **Email or phone of affected tester (no customers):** dreamnitethedragon+yydyd373@gmail.com **Issue reported by:** Applause Internal Team **Bug source:** Exploratory - Significant User Experience Deterioration **Device used:** Redminote 10S Android 13 **App Component:** Money Requests ## Action Performed: 1. Launch app 2. Login with expensifail account 3. Create a workspace 4. Open workspace chat 5. Create a distance map expense 6. Open the expense 7. Tap more - split 8. Tap first expense - distance - add a stop "your location" & save 9. Tap split expense 10. Open the expense 11. Tap receipt and note only 2 waypoints are shown 12. Tap distance and note 3 waypoints are shown ## Expected Result: Waypoints added while splitting must be shown in distance receipt. ## Actual Result: Waypoints added while splitting is not shown in distance receipt. ## Workaround: Unknown ## Platforms: - [x] Android: App - [ ] Android: mWeb Chrome - [ ] iOS: App - [ ] iOS: mWeb Safari - [ ] iOS: mWeb Chrome - [x] Windows: Chrome - [ ] MacOS: Chrome / Safari ## Screenshots/Videos https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/a50f1660-45d8-453c-9201-cae38d370f88 [View all open jobs on GitHub](https://github.com/Expensify/App/issues?q=is%3Aopen+is%3Aissue+label%3A%22Help+Wanted%22)

title: [$125] Remove TestDrive from sign-up flow

labels.name: External
labels.description: Added to denote the issue can be worked on by a contributor

labels.name: Daily
labels.description: KSv2

labels.name: Bug
labels.description: Something is broken. Auto assigns a BugZero manager.

body:
We currently have what's called a TestDrive that shows in various onboarding flows, right after the requisite, required information is provided (it differs on the onboarding intent. It looks like this. We'd like to remove this modal because: - We have a permanent training modal on Home, for new and existing users - This modal was always awkward, in that we close the required modal and then show this modal, which creates extra friction - We're making lots of changes to onboarding that focus more in immediate interaction with Concierge AI Product details for this issue: - Remove the "test drive" modal - Land the user on the relevant page, based on the onboarding intent. For most users this is going to be the Home page, but for some intents, we send them to the workspace editor directly at the moment. - We're not getting traction on the boss email input. Any other questions, let us know!
Issue OwnerCurrent Issue Owner: @Valforte
EXFY-18126
